physical_examinations.vital_signs: Resting pulse rate between 70-80 beats/min before pregnancy; pulse rate above 120 beats/min at 6-7 weeks gestation; weight loss of 2 kg by week 12 of gestation.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Moderate goiter (30-40 g), soft thyroid gland, no palpable nodules. Signs of hypermetabolism including anxiety, tremor, tiredness, and palpitations at 6-7 weeks gestation.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Resting pulse rate increased from 70-80 bpm before pregnancy to above 120 bpm at 6-7 weeks gestation; symptoms subsided after 16 weeks gestation as FT3 and FT4 levels declined.
